result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody M Mailhot was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody M Mailhot is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Cody M Mailhot was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Warrant satisfed; defendant may be released

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Defendant Cody M Mailhot in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was picked up for failure to appear on February 8th for a Motion to terminate the DPA.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant wants to proceed with a plea today.  Atty Zamzow is prepared to proceed today with sentencing with the recorder.

BY THE COURT:  Based on the stipulation by counsel; court will proceed with the plea.

Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  Atty Zamzow states that she has not heard from her client.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
Sentencing hearing on February 8, 2018 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow states that her client could not get here today and requests a return be set.
  Atty Hendee makes a statement to the court and will leave the warrant up to the court. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset.
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on January 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this was a continued motion to terminate the DPA based on the defendant not providing proof of community service.  The State received a letter today from Habitat for Humanity but it was not done in a timely manner.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that there was some confusion in the beginning and that is why he did not get it done timely.  

BY THE COURT:  Court grants the motion to terminate the DPA and finds the defendant guilty; judgment of conviction is entered as of today's date.
Set for sentencing.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.
bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2018 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 22, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant now appears in court.  Atty Hendee withdraws his request for a warrant.  States that this is a continue of the State's motion to terminate the DPA.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant responds and asks for more time.  

BY THE COURT:  Court advises the defendant how to get a court appointed Attorney and will reset one more time.
bond continued  Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant called the JA yesterday but his request to reset was denied.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
to Court from Denise Dudek of Habitat for Humanity
Motion hearing on October 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA that was reset to today's date.  Defendant did file documentation with the DA's office this morning with what he felt was community service.
Court questions counsel.  Atty Hendee states that the defendant completed 40 hours at an establishment that he just didn't get paid for; not considered community service.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant does not understand why his hours do not count for community service.  Defendant asks to move forward with the matter today.  Defendant wants to get Atty Henney again.

BY THE COURT:  Reset motion to give the defendant time to fill out financial for court appointed Attorney, Atty Henney.
bond continued  Motion hearing scheduled for October 19, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
based on Court appearance 6-21-2017
Motion hearing on August 16, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant now appears; was supposed to appear in court this morning and a Warrant was issued.  
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed based on appearance of defendant.

Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate the DPA based on non-compliance.  Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant responds and thought he would get something in the mail for his community service.  
Court confirms the address. Defendant gives a new address.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset; defendant is to provide documentation to the DA.
bond continued  Motion hearing scheduled for August 16, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.
to Terminate Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Motion hearing on June 21, 2017 at 09:30 am.
in Support to Motion to Terminate DPA
Motion hearing at 03-17-2016 10:45 am
Affidavit in support of motion to terminate DPA
to terminate DPA

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court with attorney Timothy C. Henney.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Upon the defendant's plea to Ct 1 and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 18 months.  Count 2 will be dismissed.  Atty Henney agrees.  Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.   Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Henney.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  Atty Hendee makes statement.  Atty Henney makes statement.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 18 month DPA on Ct 1.  Count 2 is ordered dismissed.
Return date at 12-03-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that it is unclear if the defendant would still like to have counsel.  Court states that yesterday, the PD office appointed Atty Tim Henney.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like an Attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-19-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the victim asked to modify the bond at the last hearing.  Court questions the defendant regarding an Attorney.  Defendant states that the victim lied about what happened and states that an officer was going to come and talk with her and has not done so.  Court states that he does not want to hear the case at this time as the defendant wanted to get counsel.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney and will contact the PD office.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give the defendant time to get an Attorney.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim is in court.
Court questions Ms. Lindsey.  Ms. Lindsey asks that the no contact be lifted.
Michael Mailhot (defendant's father) makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court will lift the no contact order; condition will be amended to No violent or abusive contact with Ms. Lindsey.
Bail/bond hearing at 09-04-2015 01:15 pm

with conditions:
*No contact with Hannah Lindsey unless as authorized by the family court in Marquette County.
*Contact through a 3rd party should be done for purposes of exchanging of the child

Defendant Cody M Mailhot in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to get an Attorney and is not working right now.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Court finds probable cause.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
No contact with Hannah Lindsey

Defendant states that he just had a baby with Hannah and asks how the no contact is supposed to be handled.  
Court staets that he cannot make a decision through this case for the family matter.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $2,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No contact with Hannah Lindsey unless as authorized by the family court in Marquette County.
*Contact through a 3rd party should be done for purposes of exchanging of the child  Return date scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
